clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Evaluation of Anti-retroviral Combinations for Treatment Naive, HIV Infected Persons in Resource-limited Settings
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Open-Label Evaluation of Efficacy of Once-Daily Protease Inhibitor and Once-Daily Non-Nucleoside Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitor-Containing Therapy Combinations for Initial Treatment of HIV-1 Infected Persons From Resource-Limited Settings (PEARLS) Trial

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: This study compared 3 different three-drug combinations in HIV infected individuals starting their first HIV treatment regimens. Participants were recruited from resource-limited areas in Africa, Asia, South America, Haiti, and also from the United States. The study hypothesis was each of the once daily combinations (PI based, or NNRTI based) would not have inferior efficacy compared to the twice daily NNRTI based combination.

detailed_description.textblock:
In developed countries, standard effective antiretroviral (ARV) therapy for treatment-naive HIV infected people includes three-drug combinations of two nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs) with either a protease inhibitor (PI) or a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI). However, direct comparisons of ARV efficacy in persons that more closely reflect the worldwide demographics of HIV-1 infection are needed.
>
> Trial participants were recruited in Africa (Malawi, South Africa, Zimbabwe), Asia (India, Thailand), South America (Brazil, Peru), Haiti, and the United States.
>
> All participants were randomly assigned to one of three arms, and random allocation was stratified by 2 factors: country, and screening plasma HIV-1 RNA level (< 100,000 copies/mL versus >= 100,000 copies/mL). Participants assigned to the ZDV/3TC+EFV arm received lamivudine/zidovudine twice daily and efavirenz once daily. Participants assigned to the ddI+FTC+ATV arm received emtricitabine, atazanavir, and enteric-coated didanosine once daily. Participants assigned to the TDF/FTC+EFV arm received emtricitabine, tenofovir disoproxil fumarate, and efavirenz once daily.
>
>
> Physical exam and blood collection occurred at entry and at most study visits. Participants experiencing virologic failure were offered a switch to another regimen.
>
> On May 23, 2008, the ddI+FTC+ATV was closed following a planned interim review by the study's independent Data and Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB). The DSMB recommendation was based upon compelling evidence that this arm had significantly more virologic failure (and therefore was inferior when) compared to the ZDV/3TC+EFV arm . Participants still receiving ddI+FTC+ATV were offered alternative medications, and all participants continued to be followed.
>
> On November 3, 2009, the DSMB recommended that the study close to all follow-up on May 31, 2010, before the designed termination (based on 30% of participants meeting the primary outcome) was met. The board observed that the recent accumulation of primary efficacy events (i.e. regimen failures) was very slow. Therefore, if the study were to continue another 1-2 years, the precision gained for treatment comparisons would likely be small.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Virologic failure starting 14 weeks following randomization; disease progression starting 12 weeks following randomization; and death occurring at any time following randomization. Follow-up until ddI+FTC+ATV arm closed (May 22, 2008).
primary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to the earliest of: scheduled week of first plasma sample meeting virologic failure (two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values 1,000 copies/mL or higher, regardless of whether ARV medications being taken at the time); scheduled week of first AIDS defining diagnosis (WHO Stage 4 (2005), plus microsporidiosis, cyclospora gastroenteritis and Chaga's disease), not attributed to Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome (reviewed by chairs); date of death (due to any cause). Plasma drawn every 8 weeks (except confirmation samples could be drawn earlier).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Virologic failure starting 14 weeks following randomization; disease progression starting 12 weeks following randomization; and death occurring at any time following randomization. Follow-up through study closure (May 31, 2010).
primary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to the earliest of: scheduled week of first plasma sample meeting virologic failure (two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values 1,000 copies/mL or higher, regardless of whether ARV medications being taken at the time); scheduled week of first AIDS defining diagnosis (WHO Stage 4 (2005) plus microsporidiosis, cyclospora gastroenteritis and Chaga's disease), not attributed to Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome (reviewed by chairs); date of death (due to any cause). Plasma drawn every 8 weeks (except confirmation samples could be drawn earlier).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Discontinuation of Initial Antiretroviral (ARV) Therapy (PI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout follow-up until ddI+FTC+ATV arm closed (May 22,2008)
secondary_outcome.description: Time is measured from date of treatment initiation to earliest of the following: date of last participant contact (premature discontinuation of study follow-up); date all ARV medications were held (if all medications held for at least 8 weeks, for any reason); date that any ARV medication was changed (excluding the following single ARV substitutions: stavudine or tenofovir for zidovudine, nevirapine for efavirenz, or didanosine for tenofovir).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At or after Week 48 (including only follow-up until ddI+FTV+ATV arm closed - May 22,2008)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to the first scheduled study visit (week 48 or later) with a CD4+ cell count fewer than 100 cells/mm3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in CD4 Count From Screening to Weeks 24, 48, 96 (PI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: weeks 24, 48 and 96 (including follow-up until ddI+FTC+ARV arm closed - May 22, 2008)
secondary_outcome.description: Available pre-randomization CD4 cell counts were limited to the single CD4 cell count used for study eligibility (and therefore must have been fewer than 300 cells/mm3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Dose Modification or Grade 3 or 4 Adverse Event (PI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study follow-up until ddI+FTC+ATV arm closed (May 22, 2008)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment dispensation to the first occurring of the following: week of first ARV medication change; week of first grade 3 or higher sign/symptom or laboratory abnormality (total bilirubin was excluded) that was at least one grade higher than baseline. Grading used the Division of AIDS (DAIDS) 2004 Severity of Adverse Events Tables.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma HIV-1 Viral Load Fewer Than 400 Copies/ml (PI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Weeks 24 and 48 (including only follow-up until ddI+FTC+ARV arm closed - May 22, 2008)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with plasma HIV-1 Viral load fewer than 400 copies/mL at study visit weeks 24 and 48. Closest observed result between 20 and up to 28 weeks (for week 24), and between 44 and up to 52 (for week 48) used if multiple results available. Missing values excluded, and both study treatment status and history ignored.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Loss of Virologic Response by Week 48 (Defined by FDA TLOVR Algorithm - Excluding Study Allowed ARV Substitutions)(PI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48 (using follow-up only until closing of ddI+FTV+ATV arm on May 22,2008)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to any of the following events occurring prior to week 48: discontinued ARV regimen (see time to discontinuation of initial ARV therapy above); discontinued study follow-up or died; absence of virologic suppression defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values < 400 copies/mL; two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values > 400 copies/mL following virologic suppression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Loss of Virologic Response at Week 48 (Defined by FDA TLOVR Algorithm - Including All ARV Substitutions)(PI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48 (using follow-up only until closing of ddI+FTV+ATV arm on May 22,2008)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to any of the following events occurring prior to week 48: changed any ARV medication (including permanent discontinuation of all medications); discontinued study follow-up or died; absence of virologic suppression defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values < 400 copies/mL; two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values > 400 copies/mL following virologic suppression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Discontinuation of Initial Antiretroviral (ARV) Therapy (NRTI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.description: Time is measured from date of treatment initiation to earliest of the following: date of last participant contact (premature discontinuation of study follow-up); date all ARV medications were held (if all medications held for at least 8 weeks, for any reason); date that any ARV medication was changed (excluding the following single ARV substitutions: stavudine or tenofovir for zidovudine, nevirapine for efavirenz, or didanosine for tenofovir).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At or after Week 48 (including all follow-up through study closure - May 31,2010)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to the first scheduled study visit (week 48 or later) with a CD4+ cell count fewer than 100 cells/mm3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in CD4 Count From Screening to Weeks 24, 48, 96 (NRTI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: weeks 24, 48 and 96 (including all follow-up through to study closure on May 31, 2010)
secondary_outcome.description: Available pre-randomization CD4 cell counts were limited to the single CD4 cell count used for study eligibility (and therefore must have been fewer than 300 cells/mm3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma HIV-1 Viral Load Fewer Than 400 Copies/ml (NRTI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Weeks 24 and 48 (including follow-up through to study closure on May 31, 2010)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with plasma HIV-1 Viral load fewer than 400 copies/mL at study visit weeks 24 and 48. Closest observed result between 20 and up to 28 weeks (for week 24), and between 44 and up to 52 (for week 48) used if multiple results available. Missing values excluded, and both study treatment status and history ignored.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Loss of Virologic Response at Week 48 (Defined by FDA TLOVR Algorithm - Excluding Study Allowed ARV Substitutions)(NRTI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48 (using follow-up through study closure on May 31,2010)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to any of the following events occurring prior to week 48: discontinued ARV regimen (see time to discontinuation of initial ARV therapy above); discontinued study follow-up or died; absence of virologic suppression defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values < 400 copies/mL; two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values > 400 copies/mL following virologic suppression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Loss of Virologic Response at Week 96 (Defined by FDA TLOVR Algorithm - Excluding Study Allowed ARV Substitutions)(NRTI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 96 (using follow-up through to study closure on May 31,2010)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to any of the following events occurring prior to week 96: discontinued ARV regimen (see time to discontinuation of initial ARV therapy above); discontinued study follow-up or died; absence of virologic suppression defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values < 400 copies/mL; two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values > 400 copies/mL following virologic suppression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Loss of Virologic Response at Week 48 (Defined by FDA TLOVR Algorithm - Including All ARV Substitutions)(NRTI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48 using follow-up through study closure on May 31,2010
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to any of the following events occurring prior to week 48: changed any ARV medication (including permanent discontinuation of all medications); discontinued study follow-up or died; absence of virologic suppression defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values < 400 copies/mL; two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values > 400 copies/mL following virologic suppression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Loss of Virologic Response at Week 96 (Defined by FDA TLOVR Algorithm - Including All ARV Substitutions)(NRTI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 96 using follow-up through study closure on May 31,2010
secondary_outcome.description: Time to any of the following events occurring prior to week 96: changed any ARV medication (including permanent discontinuation of all medications); discontinued study follow-up or died; absence of virologic suppression defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values < 400 copies/mL; two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values > 400 copies/mL following virologic suppression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Dose Modification or Grade 3 or 4 Adverse Event (NRTI Comparison)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study follow-up until study closure (May 31, 2010)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment dispensation to the first occurring of the following: week of first ARV medication change; week of first grade 3 or higher sign/symptom or laboratory abnormality (total bilirubin was excluded) that was at least one grade higher than baseline. Grading used the Division of AIDS (DAIDS) 2004 Severity of Adverse Events Tables.

arm_group.description: ZDV/3TC+EFV participants will receive lamivudine/zidovudine and efavirenz
ddI+FTC+ATV participants will receive emtricitabine, atazanavir, and enteric-coated didanosine
TDF/FTC+EFV participants will receive emtricitabine/tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and efavirenz

intervention.description: 200 mg/300 mg taken orally once daily
150 mg/300 mg taken orally twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria :
- HIV-1 infected
- CD4 count fewer than 300 cells/mm3
- Viral load test result
- Absolute Neutrophil Count at least 750mm3
- Hemoglobin at least 7.5 g/dL
- Platelet count at least 50,000/mm3
- Calculated creatinine clearance at least 60 mL/min
- A , A, and alkaline phosphatase <= 5 times upper limit of normal
- total bilirubin <= 2.5 times upper limit of normal
- Karnofsky performance score of 70 or higher
- Plans to stay in the area for the duration of the study
- Agrees to use acceptable forms of contraception for the duration of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- More than 7 days exposure to ARVs (except for single-dose NVP or ZDV for any period for the purpose of pMTCT)
- Acute therapy for serious medical illnesses within 14 days prior to study entry
- Certain abnormal laboratory values
- Radiation therapy or chemotherapy within 45 days prior to study entry.
- Any immunomodulator, HIV vaccine, or other investigational therapy within 30 days prior to study entry.
- Current alcohol or drug abuse that, in the opinion of the site investigator, would interfere with study participation
- Inflamed pancreas within 3 years prior to study entry
- Allergy/sensitivity to any of the study drugs or their formulations
- Heart rate less than 40 beats/min
- History of untreated, active second- or third-degree heart block
- Currently detained in jail or for treatment of a psychiatric or physical illness
- Vomiting or inability to swallow medications
- Pregnancy

reference.citation: Bartlett JA, Johnson J, Herrera G, Sosa N, Rodriguez A, Liao Q, Griffith S, Irlbeck D, Shaefer MS; Clinically Significant Long-Term Antiretroviral Sequential Sequencing Study (CLASS) Team. Long-term results of initial therapy with abacavir and Lamivudine combined with Efavirenz, Amprenavir/Ritonavir, or Stavudine. J Acquir Immune Defic Syndr. 2006 Nov 1;43(3):284-92.
Saag MS. Initiation of antiretroviral therapy: implications of recent findings. Top HIV Med. 2004 Jul-Aug;12(3):83-8. Review.
Tapper ML, Daar ES, Piliero PJ, Smith K, Steinhart C. Strategies for initiating combination antiretroviral therapy. AIDS Patient Care STDS. 2005 Apr;19(4):224-38. Review.

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Emtricitabine, Tenofovir Disoproxil Fumarate Drug Combination

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study participants were recruited at 43 sites from 9 countries: 28 in the US, 4 in India, 2 each in Brazil, Malawi, Peru and South Africa, and 1 each in Haiti, Thailand and Zimbabwe, between May 2005 to August 2007.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: HIV-infected, treatment-naive men and women, at least 18 years of age with CD4+ count <300 cells/mm^3.

group.title: ZDV/3TC+EFV
group.description: ZDV/3TC+EFV participants will receive lamivudine/zidovudine and efavirenz

group.title: ddI+FTC+ATV
group.description: ddI+FTC+ATV participants will receive emtricitabine, atazanavir, and enteric-coated didanosine > > On May 23, 2008, Arm B was closed following a planned interim review by the study's independent Data and Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB). The DSMB recommendation was based upon compelling evidence that Arm B had significantly more virologic failure (and therefore was inferior when) compared to Arm A. Participants still receiving Arm B medications were offered alternatives, and all participants continued to be followed.

group.description: TDF/FTC+EFV participants will receive emtricitabine/tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and efavirenz

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure (PI Comparison)
outcome.description: Time from randomization to the earliest of: scheduled week of first plasma sample meeting virologic failure (two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values 1,000 copies/mL or higher, regardless of whether ARV medications being taken at the time); scheduled week of first AIDS defining diagnosis (WHO Stage 4 (2005), plus microsporidiosis, cyclospora gastroenteritis and Chaga's disease), not attributed to Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome (reviewed by chairs); date of death (due to any cause). Plasma drawn every 8 weeks (except confirmation samples could be drawn earlier).
outcome.time_frame: Virologic failure starting 14 weeks following randomization; disease progression starting 12 weeks following randomization; and death occurring at any time following randomization. Follow-up until ddI+FTC+ATV arm closed (May 22, 2008).
outcome.population: ITT (study treatment status and history ignored); censoring time was latest study visit week where plasma HIV-1 RNA was measured.

measure.title: Time to Treatment Failure (PI Comparison)
measure.description: Time from randomization to the earliest of: scheduled week of first plasma sample meeting virologic failure (two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values 1,000 copies/mL or higher, regardless of whether ARV medications being taken at the time); scheduled week of first AIDS defining diagnosis (WHO Stage 4 (2005), plus microsporidiosis, cyclospora gastroenteritis and Chaga's disease), not attributed to Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome (reviewed by chairs); date of death (due to any cause). measurement_list.measurement: Not estimable as the estimate for survival function at all weeks is above 75%
Not estimable as the upper limit for survival function at all weeks is above 75%

analysis.p_value_desc: Not adjusted for multiple interim analyses. Peto-Haybittle spending function was used as a basis for calculating the repeated confidence intervals used in interim monitoring.
analysis.method_desc: Log-rank test was stratified by country and screening RNA (< 100,000 c/mL vs >= 100,000 copies/mL).
analysis.estimate_desc: The HR is for ddI+FTC+ATV vs. ZDV/3TC+EFV.

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure (NRTI Comparison)
outcome.description: Time from randomization to the earliest of: scheduled week of first plasma sample meeting virologic failure (two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values 1,000 copies/mL or higher, regardless of whether ARV medications being taken at the time); scheduled week of first AIDS defining diagnosis (WHO Stage 4 (2005) plus microsporidiosis, cyclospora gastroenteritis and Chaga's disease), not attributed to Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome (reviewed by chairs); date of death (due to any cause). Plasma drawn every 8 weeks (except confirmation samples could be drawn earlier).
outcome.time_frame: Virologic failure starting 14 weeks following randomization; disease progression starting 12 weeks following randomization; and death occurring at any time following randomization. Follow-up through study closure (May 31, 2010).
outcome.population: ITT (study treatment status and history ignored); censoring time was latest study visit week where plasma HIV-1 RNA was measured.

measurement_list.measurement: Not estimable as the estimate for survival function at all weeks is above 75%
Not estimable as the estimate for survival function at all weeks is above 75%

analysis.groups_desc: While original study design specified a non-inferiority test, study follow-up stopped early, not due to treatment effect size or futility, but due to slowing accumulation of primary outcome events. Therefore, 2-sided, 95% confidence intervals about the estimated treatment effect (relative effect estimated by a hazard ratio) are provided.
analysis.estimate_desc: The HR is for TDF/FTC+EFV vs. ZDV/3TC+EFV.

outcome.title: Time to Discontinuation of Initial Antiretroviral (ARV) Therapy (PI Comparison)
outcome.description: Time is measured from date of treatment initiation to earliest of the following: date of last participant contact (premature discontinuation of study follow-up); date all ARV medications were held (if all medications held for at least 8 weeks, for any reason); date that any ARV medication was changed (excluding the following single ARV substitutions: stavudine or tenofovir for zidovudine, nevirapine for efavirenz, or didanosine for tenofovir).
outcome.time_frame: Throughout follow-up until ddI+FTC+ATV arm closed (May 22,2008)
outcome.population: Participants not starting study treatment excluded.

outcome.time_frame: Throughout study follow-up until ddI+FTC+ATV arm closed (May 22, 2008)
outcome.population: Participants never starting meds excluded. Censoring time is scheduled study week of last clinic visit.

group.title: ZDV/3TC+EFV
group.description: ZDV/3TC+EFV participants will receive lamivudine/zidovudine and efavirenz

group.title: ddI+FTC+ATV
group.description: ddI+FTC+ATV participants will receive emtricitabine, atazanavir, and enteric-coated didanosine

group.title: TDF/FTC+EFV
group.description: TDF/FTC+EFV participants will receive emtricitabine/tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and efavirenz

measure.title: Time to First Dose Modification or Grade 3 or 4 Adverse Event (PI Comparison)
measure.description: Time from treatment dispensation to the first occurring of the following: week of first ARV medication change; week of first grade 3 or higher sign/symptom or laboratory abnormality (total bilirubin was excluded) that was at least one grade higher than baseline. Grading used the Division of AIDS (DAIDS) 2004 Severity of Adverse Events Tables.
measure.population: Participants never starting meds excluded. Censoring time is scheduled study week of last clinic visit.

measurement_list.measurement: Not estimable as the upper limit for survival function at all weeks is above 50%

outcome.title: Plasma HIV-1 Viral Load Fewer Than 400 Copies/ml (PI Comparison)
outcome.description: Number of participants with plasma HIV-1 Viral load fewer than 400 copies/mL at study visit weeks 24 and 48. Closest observed result between 20 and up to 28 weeks (for week 24), and between 44 and up to 52 (for week 48) used if multiple results available. Missing values excluded, and both study treatment status and history ignored.
outcome.time_frame: At Weeks 24 and 48 (including only follow-up until ddI+FTC+ARV arm closed - May 22, 2008)
outcome.population: ITT (ignoring current treatment status or past treatment history); closest value to week 24 (48) used if multiple values available; missing values ignored.

group.title: ZDV/3TC+EFV
group.description: ZDV/3TC+EFV participants will receive lamivudine/zidovudine and efavirenz

group.title: ddI+FTC+ATV
group.description: ddI+FTC+ATV participants will receive emtricitabine, atazanavir, and enteric-coated didanosine > > On May 23, 2008, Arm B was closed following a planned interim review by the study's independent Data and Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB). The DSMB recommendation was based upon compelling evidence that Arm B had significantly more virologic failure (and therefore was inferior when) compared to Arm A. Participants still receiving Arm B medications were offered alternatives, and all participants continued to be followed.

group.title: TDF/FTC+EFV
group.description: TDF/FTC+EFV participants will receive emtricitabine/tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and efavirenz

measure.title: Plasma HIV-1 Viral Load Fewer Than 400 Copies/ml (PI Comparison)
measure.description: Number of participants with plasma HIV-1 Viral load fewer than 400 copies/mL at study visit weeks 24 and 48. Closest observed result between 20 and up to 28 weeks (for week 24), and between 44 and up to 52 (for week 48) used if multiple results available. Missing values excluded, and both study treatment status and history ignored.
measure.population: ITT (ignoring current treatment status or past treatment history); closest value to week 24 (48) used if multiple values available; missing values ignored.

class.title: Week 24: Number with RNA <400 c/mL (N=495; N=506)
Week 48: Number with RNA <400 c/mL (N=476; N=478)

outcome.title: Time to Loss of Virologic Response by Week 48 (Defined by FDA TLOVR Algorithm - Excluding Study Allowed ARV Substitutions)(PI Comparison)
outcome.description: Time from randomization to any of the following events occurring prior to week 48: discontinued ARV regimen (see time to discontinuation of initial ARV therapy above); discontinued study follow-up or died; absence of virologic suppression defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values < 400 copies/mL; two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values > 400 copies/mL following virologic suppression.
outcome.time_frame: Week 48 (using follow-up only until closing of ddI+FTV+ATV arm on May 22,2008)
outcome.population: Substitutions not triggering TLOVR event included the following: stavudine or tenofovir-DF for zidovudine; nevirapine for efavirenz; or didanosine for tenofovir-DF.

outcome.title: Time to Loss of Virologic Response at Week 48 (Defined by FDA TLOVR Algorithm - Including All ARV Substitutions)(PI Comparison)
outcome.description: Time from randomization to any of the following events occurring prior to week 48: changed any ARV medication (including permanent discontinuation of all medications); discontinued study follow-up or died; absence of virologic suppression defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values < 400 copies/mL; two consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA values > 400 copies/mL following virologic suppression.
outcome.time_frame: Week 48 (using follow-up only until closing of ddI+FTV+ATV arm on May 22,2008)

outcome.title: Time to Discontinuation of Initial Antiretroviral (ARV) Therapy (NRTI Comparison)
outcome.description: Time is measured from date of treatment initiation to earliest of the following: date of last participant contact (premature discontinuation of study follow-up); date all ARV medications were held (if all medications held for at least 8 weeks, for any reason); date that any ARV medication was changed (excluding the following single ARV substitutions: stavudine or tenofovir for zidovudine, nevirapine for efavirenz, or didanosine for tenofovir).
outcome.population: Participants not starting study treatment excluded.

measure.population: Participants not starting study treatment excluded.

measurement_list.measurement: Not estimable as the upper limit for survival function at all weeks is above 75%

outcome.title: Time to Immunologic Failure (NRTI Comparison)
outcome.description: Time from randomization to the first scheduled study visit (week 48 or later) with a CD4+ cell count fewer than 100 cells/mm3.
outcome.time_frame: At or after Week 48 (including all follow-up through study closure - May 31,2010)

outcome.title: Change in CD4 Count From Screening to Weeks 24, 48, 96 (NRTI Comparison)
outcome.description: Available pre-randomization CD4 cell counts were limited to the single CD4 cell count used for study eligibility (and therefore must have been fewer than 300 cells/mm3).
outcome.time_frame: weeks 24, 48 and 96 (including all follow-up through to study closure on May 31, 2010)
outcome.population: ITT - ignoring both current treatment status and treatment history.

reported_events.time_frame: Throughout study follow-up (until May 31, 2010 or earlier only if participant prematurely left the study).
reported_events.desc: Standard Level reporting by DAIDS EAE Manual,May 6, 2004(http://rcc.tech-res.com/safetyandpharmacovigilance/). ATV-related, asymptomatic hyperbilirubinemia or jaundice without LFT elevation does not require (EAE) reporting. IRIS events do not fulfill the DAIDS EAE reporting criteria, even if the event is severe in intensity.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Squamous cell carcinoma of the cervix

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: In accordance with the Clinical Trial Agreement between NIAID (DAIDS) and company collaborators, NIAID (DAIDS) provides companies with a copy of any abstract, press release, or manuscript prior to submission for publication with sufficient time for company review and comment. The publication/other disclosure can be delayed for up to 30 additional business days for manuscripts and five (5) business days for abstracts, to preserve U.S. or foreign patent or other intellectual property rights

point_of_contact.organization: Center for Biostatistics in AIDS Research, Harvard School of Public Health
